Description: Greek style female terracotta figure. Mould-made hollow figure or protome in the form of the face of a female figure. Face fragment only. Traces of white of slip surviving.
Curator's comments: Missing, but published in original Naukratis publication (Gardner 1888, pl. xv). Classical Greek style terracotta. Three similar pieces from Naukratis have different fabrics are in the British Museum (GR2011,5009.285, 287, 286), Bristol Museum (H446.b, imported) and Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology (NA351 made in Egypt). These small fragments seem to be of a style seen on Classical Greek standing and seated women figurines of the early to mid 5th century BC from Rhodes, Attica and Cyrenaica (Higgins 1954, 111, 204, 220-8, 669-74, 1422).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.001) (Phase 3)
